title: std::thread::sleep does not compile
body:
I tried this code:

```
use std::thread;
fn main() {
        std::thread::sleep(100);
        println!("Done");    
}

```

I get the same errors if I use 

```
use std::thread::sleep;
fn main() {
        std::thread::sleep(100);
        println!("Done");    
}

```

I expected the above code to compile.
Instead, I got the errors listed at the end of this report.

I am using Windows 7, rustc 1.7.0, cargo 0.8.0-nightly

> rustc --version --verbose
> rustc 1.7.0 (a5d1e7a59 2016-02-29)
> binary: rustc
> commit-hash: a5d1e7a59a2a3413c377b003075349f854304b5e
> commit-date: 2016-02-29
> host: x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
> release: 1.7.0

I tried the cargo command below, with the shown results.

C:\Users\loginname\Documents\rust\learn\nightly\test_sleep>cargo build
   Compiling test_sleep v0.1.0 (file:/C:/Users/loginname/Documents/rust/learn/nightly/test_sleep)
src\main.rs:5:28: 5:31 error: mismatched types:
 expected `std::time::duration::Duration`,
    found `_`
(expected struct `std::time::duration::Duration`,
    found integral variable) [E0308]
src\main.rs:5         std::thread::sleep(100);
                                         ^~~
src\main.rs:5:28: 5:31 help: run `rustc --explain E0308` to see a detailed explanation
error: aborting due to previous error
Could not compile `test_sleep`.
